title: Cross-Platform Installer Design - Double Click and Done
summary: Effective installer design prioritizes user experience over developer convenience. Multiple format options per platform, GUI wrappers around scripts, and the golden rule: double click should work.

patterns: GUI downloads scripts at runtime (always current)
multiple formats per platform (AppImage, deb, script)
fallback: try prebuilt binary, then build from source
design_principles: no terminal required for basic users
uninstall should be just as easy

examples.gui_wrapper_pattern: Tauri app that downloads and runs install.ps1/install.sh at runtime
examples.fallback_chain: try download binary -> fail? -> check for rust -> build from source -> fail? -> show manual instructions

antipatterns: requiring dev tools for end users
assuming users know what PATH is
wisdom: Your nan should be able to install it
If Microsoft needed terminal installers, they'd be worth $4
The 99% of users don't know what a terminal is

author: BMETALC
